result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Manuel Juarez-Castro

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Manuel Juarez-Castro in court.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court for Anthony Manuel Juarez-Castro.  Attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 096428,
Payable Number: 1037723,
Receipt Number: 22RP040581,
Amount: $20.00
Matter is re-assigned to Br. 40 Judge Shelton due to the nature of the charges and the co-defendant 22cm2066.

Defendant Anthony Manuel Juarez-Castro in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Patrikus has been retained.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
updated 08/15/2022 entry. Bail entered as an error. updated bail $2,500.00 signature bond.

Defendant Anthony Manuel Juarez-Castro in court in person.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel..
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Anthony Manuel Juarez-Castro in court with attorney Erica N Young.  Defendant Anthony Manuel Juarez-Castro in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT ELGIBLE FOR A PUBLIC DEFENDER.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
